info.title: GitHub File Proxy + Promote Patch Tool
info.description: Fetch GitHub repo files and generate patch metadata for AI-native delivery.

post.summary: Retrieve metrics summary or export full report

x-gpt-action.name: Fetch Delivery or Reasoning Metrics
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to get delivery or reasoning metrics. Choose mode: `summary` for aggregated stats, `export` for raw task-level data.

mode.description: Whether to return a summary or full export

format.description: Format of export (optional, default is JSON)

200.description: Returns metrics summary or full report

get.description: Returns a grouped list of actions with names, paths, descriptions, and methods.

x-gpt-action.name: List Available Actions
x-gpt-action.instructions: Retrieve a list of actions grouped by functionality, including paths, descriptions, and supported methods.

200.description: List of available actions grouped by category

post.summary: Fetch one or more files from a GitHub repo

x-gpt-action.name: Fetch Files from Repo
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to retrieve one or more files. Set `mode` to `single` or `batch`. Provide `path` for single or `paths` array for batch.

mode.description: Whether to fetch a single file or a list

path.description: Path to a single file (required for mode=single)

paths.description: List of file paths (required for mode=batch)

post.summary: Initialize a new project in the given repo

x-gpt-action.name: Initialize Project
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to set up a new project in the specified GitHub repository.

post.summary: Commit and log a single output file for a task

x-gpt-action.name: Commit and Log Output File
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to commit and log a single output file for a task.

repo_name.description: The name of the GitHub repository (e.g. nhl-predictor)

task_id.description: The ID of the task being committed

file_path.description: The path to the file being committed

content.description: The content of the file being committed

message.description: The commit message for the file

committed_by.description: The name of the person or gpt pod committing the file

post.summary: Rollback specific files to previous commit

x-gpt-action.name: Rollback Commit
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to revert files to a previous commit version. Use with caution. Log a reason for rollback.

repo_name.description: The name of the GitHub repository (e.g. nhl-predictor)

commit_sha.description:
The SHA of the commit to rollback from.

How to find it:
- Use `git log` locally, or
- Visit the GitHub repo ➜ Commits tab ➜ Copy the commit hash
- Or call the `/git/list_commits` tool (if available)

paths.description: Optional list of file paths to revert. If omitted, all files from the commit will be reverted.

reason.description: Why the rollback is being performed (e.g., accidental overwrite, failed auto-index, etc.)

post.summary: Return the onboarding guide from GitHub

x-gpt-action.name: Get Onboarding Guide
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to retrieve onboarding instructions. Set `simple=true` for a non-technical guide.

simple.description: Set to true to retrieve a non-technical guide

get.summary: Fetch all artifacts for a specific task

x-gpt-action.name: Get Task Artifacts
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to retrieve all related data for a task, including its prompt, outputs, chain of thought, reasoning trace, and handoff notes.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The task ID for which to fetch artifacts

200.description: All available artifacts related to the task

prompt.description: Prompt content used to start the task

outputs.description: Dictionary of output file paths and contents

reasoning_trace.description: Reasoning trace dictionary generated by the GPT pod

post.summary: Perform memory file operations (add, index, diff, validate)

x-gpt-action.name: Manage Memory Files
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to add, index, diff, or validate memory entries. Set the `action` parameter and include the correct fields for each operation.

action.description:
**add**: add files with optional metadata
**index**: scan base_paths for new files
**diff**: list missing memory entries
**validate**: check if files exist in memory.yaml and GitHub

post.summary: Query memory index (search, list, or stats)

x-gpt-action.name: Query Memory Index
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to search, list, or summarize the memory index. Set `mode` to one of: `search`, `list`, or `stats`, and include required fields per mode.

post.summary: Update or remove a memory entry

x-gpt-action.name: Manage Memory Entry
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to update or remove a memory entry. Set `action` to `update` or `remove`, and include `repo_name` and `path`. For updates, include optional fields to modify.

path.description: Path of the file to update or remove

action.description: `update` to change metadata, `remove` to delete entry

x-gpt-action.name: Manage Task Metadata
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to update a task’s metadata or to clone a task. Set `action` to `update_metadata` or `clone`.

repo_name.description: Repository name where the task lives

action.description: `update_metadata` for metadata edits, `clone` to copy a task

task_id.description: ID of the task to update (required for `update_metadata`)

original_task_id.description: ID of the task to clone (required for `clone`)

descriptor.description: Descriptor of the cloned task’s purpose

post.summary: Manage task lifecycle: activate, start, complete, reopen, next, scale out, or create

action.description:
Lifecycle action to perform. Each action has specific required fields.

- `activate`: Mark task(s) as `planned`
- `start`: Mark as `in_progress` and log prompt
- `complete`: Finalize task and store outputs
- `reopen`: Reopen completed task
- `next`: Get next available task for a Pod
- `scale_out`: Clone and continue task
- `create`: Generate new task from template

repo_name.description: GitHub repository where the task is defined (required for all actions)

task_id.description: ID of the task (required for: start, complete, reopen, scale_out)

prompt_used.description: Prompt content used to start the task (required for: start)

outputs.description: Files generated by the task (required for: complete)

reasoning_trace.description: Reasoning trace for the task (optional for: complete)

handoff_note.description: Structured note passed to next pod or task (optional for: complete, scale_out)

handoff_to_same_pod.description: Optional flag used in 'complete' to indicate scale continuation

pod_owner.description: Which pod to query for next task (used in: next)

phase.description: Phase where new task is created (used in: create)

task_key.description: Task template path in framework (used in: create)

prompt_variables.description: Optional inputs for prompt customization (used in: create)

post.summary: Manage task handoffs (append, fetch, auto-generate, execute)

x-gpt-action.name: Manage Task Handoff
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to manage handoffs between tasks or pods. Set `action` to one of: `append`, `fetch`, `generate_auto`, or `execute_auto`.

action.description:
`append`: manually add a handoff note
`fetch`: retrieve last handoff
`generate_auto`: GPT generates note
`execute_auto`: log + link to next task

repo_name.description: GitHub repository name (required for all actions)

task_id.description: Task ID (required for all except `append`, which takes it in path)

notes.description: Extra notes for the next pod (optional)

ways_of_working.description: How the pod intends to collaborate (optional)

next_task_id.description: ID of the downstream task to receive the handoff (required in `execute_auto`)

value.next_prompt: Please test component A and validate edge case B
value.notes: Watch out for flakiness in test X

x-gpt-action.name: Manage Chain of Thought
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to append thoughts, issues, or lessons to a task or fetch an existing chain_of_thought.yaml.

action.description: `append` = log new thought, `fetch` = retrieve thoughts for a task

task_id.description: ID of the task to log or retrieve chain of thought for

tags.description: Optional list of tags (e.g., tool, phase, issue-type)

issues.description: Optional list of issues observed during the task

lessons.description: Optional list of lessons learned from the experience

append.summary: Append new thought with issues and tags

value.message: We encountered retry issues on GitHub PATCH.
issues: GitHub API rate limit caused retry delays

fetch.summary: Fetch existing chain of thought for a task

200.description: Successfully handled chain of thought action

post.summary: Fetch reasoning trace for a task or summarize reasoning across tasks

x-gpt-action.name: Reasoning Trace Manager
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to fetch the final or full reasoning trace for a task (`fetch`), or get a reasoning quality report across all tasks (`summary`).

action.description:
`fetch`: Get reasoning trace for a task
`summary`: Get reasoning quality report across all tasks

task_id.description: Required for `fetch` to specify which task's trace to retrieve

full.description: **Used in `fetch`.** If `true`, includes `prompt_used`, `chain_of_thought`, and the `reasoning_trace`. If `false`, returns only the structured `reasoning_trace` object.

format.description: **Used in `summary`.** If set to `csv`, returns the reasoning summary as a CSV string. Otherwise, returns JSON.

fetch.summary: Fetch final reasoning trace for a task

fetch_full.summary: Fetch full trace with prompt and chain_of_thought

post.summary: Query task metadata, dependencies, phases, or graph

x-gpt-action.name: Query Tasks
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to list, group, or fetch task metadata. Set `mode` to one of: `list`, `list_phases`, `graph`, `dependencies`, `get_details`.

mode.description:
Which query to run:
- `list`: List all tasks
- `list_phases`: Group tasks by SDLC phase
- `graph`: Return dependency graph
- `dependencies`: Show up/downstream of a task
- `get_details`: Return metadata for a specific task

category.description: Optional filter for `list` by task category

200.description: Query results for the selected task mode

post.summary: Log, fetch, or update bugs and enhancements in the system tracker

x-gpt-action.name: Manage Issues or Enhancements
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to log a bug/enhancement, fetch tracker entries, or update status. Choose an action from: `log`, `fetch`, `update_status`.

action.description: What kind of operation to perform.

scope.description: Where the issue applies (required for log, update_status, optional for fetch)

type.description: Type of issue (required for log, optional for fetch)

task_id.description: Optional task this issue relates to

title.description: Issue or enhancement title (required for log)

status.description: Issue status (optional for log and fetch; required for update_status)

issue_id.description: Unique ID for issue (required for update_status, optional for fetch)

value.title: Retry logic failed silently
value.detail: API returned 200 but file did not update

404.description: Entry not found (only applies to update_status)

post.summary: Validate or update the project changelog

x-gpt-action.name: Manage Changelog
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to validate changelog completeness or to add an entry for a completed task. Use `action=validate` to check for missing entries, and `action=update` to add a new one.

action.description: What to do: validate changelog completeness or add a task-specific entry

repo_name.description: GitHub repo where the changelog is tracked

dry_run.description: If true, performs validation without writing changes (only applies to action=validate)

task_id.description: Task ID being added to the changelog (only for action=update)

changelog_message.description: New entry text to be appended to the changelog (only for action=update)

value.changelog_message: Added tracing logic and error handling to GitHub push
